alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:46PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Coconino and western Yavapai Counties along Interstate 40 through 830 PM MST... At 743 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles north of Diamond M Ranch to 8 miles southwest of Seligman to 9 miles west of Ash Fork. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seligman and Cross Mountain. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 140 and 141. Route 66 between mile markers 110 and 139. Interstate 40 between mile markers 94 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Hazardous travel conditions are expected due to reduced visibility and slick roads.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
